ratings.comment: Yao Yao is an amazing professor. Unfortunately she decided to leave UW and go to  Ga tech (.. But nonetheless, she taught calc 1 and 2 with poise and clarity. 10/10 would recommend.

Very helpful when I asked questions. Makes some mistakes on the board, but loves it when people tell her about the mistakes (very gracious about it). Exams are exactly what you expect. Explains the material very well. Willing to help out when she has the time.

I took the course with power lectures, this resulted in the lectures being quite long. Other than that fact she explains the information in a very interesting and straight forward manner, with many examples. For a class like 222, she was very helpful and her exam averages were better than other professors, exams were consistent among lecturers.

Calc 222 in general is NOT an easy class, but Yao is by far one of the better professors for this course out there. Power lectures were very long but she taught the material fairly well. Honestly, I learned most of the material from my TA but Yao Yao gives lots of examples instead of long proofs which was awesome! Good luck.

Yao Yao is a pretty amazing professor.  She has just such a grasp of the material and how to best present it.  Lectures can feel pretty long at times and exams are not always the easiest, but the curve is decent and there is plenty of help along the way.  A must have professor! (I got an "A")

She is a good lecturer and is very organized. She describes concepts well and the course load isn't terrible. There were these group projects through that were long and didn't help you very much. There was also online homework as well as written homework, which seemed unnecessary. But overall, a really good professor.

Yao is a decent professor. Very nice, tries to be helpful. Occasionally funny in lecture. Makes a lot of mistakes with signs on the board. Very clear English. However, there were several lectures where I would walk out of lecture and have no idea what was covered because it was so unclear. The majority of her lectures are clear, save those several.
Great teacher, good at explaining the concepts.

Yao did a really good job of explaining things.  There was little to no curve, so you have to know your stuff.  If you dounderstand the homework the tests are fair, but sometimes she likes to throw in a problem or two that make you think beyond what she taught in lectures.  Discussions were not helpful, you were just given time to do worksheets.

Yao is a great professor. Her lectures are clear and the exams are not that hard if you worked on the problem sheet. There are other easier 221 classes if you just need math credits, but if you really want to learn something, I highly recommend her. Even I'm not her student any more, she's still willing to help me with my math problems.

Yao was always very available and helpful, gave you ample amount of resources to pass. Yao was always very helpful in class open to questions, and occasionally funny. My only big complaint all year was that there is little to no curve, so you have to know your material well.

Yao is an excellent professor. Her exams were challenging and required work on practice problems outside of the classroom, but she would also provide practice problems for exams that were a good indication of the level of difficulty and sophistication on the exam. She was always willing to meet with students outside of the classroom. Speaks clearly

If you do her practice problems and do the assignments, you'll be fine for the exams. She really wants to help and is always there for office hours. If you haven't taken calc before, this is a tough class to follow because she doesn't do a lot of examples in class. Do practice problems and work hard, and you'll be fine. She speaks great English.

Yao Yao is very easy to understand. She speaks clearly and takes the time to define concepts and then follow them up with a ton of examples. She is available via email and office hours and is very approachable. The exams are tough and you really need to have a deep understanding for the material because the curve is very small.
Professor Yao is great.  Her lectures are well organized and go over the material well.   She is very clear about expectations and good at explaining everything.

Professor Yao is a very nice professor. Very clear in lecture and sometimes really funny! Like any other math class, if you don't do the assigned math homework, practice problems, or don't go to lecture, there is a high chance of not passing. Final was average, expect challenging problems!
Easy lectures

Yao is one of the best professors you can get for 221. Sometimes she's soft spoken so make sure that she has the mic positioned  well so you can hear everything. Her tests are extremely fair and there are no surprises on them. Sometimes she rushes steps in lecture, but if you ask questions and go to office hours you'll be fine. Highly recommend!

Yao is a very good math teacher and a very fair one as well. Her tests are a true test of her lectures and her weekly quizzes. Do the assigned work and the class will be fine. Her lectures can be boring, but it is math. Would recommend as she is very accommodating and extremely helpful whenever I go to her office hours.

Yao is a great professor for Math 221. Out of all the professors, she has the best situation. In lecture, she likes to present a concept and then do several examples underneath, which I found to be very helpful. Expect moodle and homework quizzes every week, but you will learn more from her vs. other 221 professors (also has PhD from UCLA).

One of the most helpful professors I've ever had. She taught the material well and went above and beyond to make the class enjoyable and beneficial for every student. She's by no means a pushover (and her classes are hard), and she is incredibly caring.

Great Professor! Perhaps my favorite class so far at UW. And I'm a senior! Yao is super clear about concepts, follows a predictable style in terms of assigning homework and exam questions. She's open to criticism and every once in a while says something hilarious. Take her if you get a chance.
